verses.kjv: In the third year of the reign of king Belshazzar a vision appeared unto me, even unto me Daniel, after that which appeared unto me at the first.
verses.ct: During the 3rd year of King Belshazzar's reign, I, Daniel, received a vision — a second one, following the vision I had received earlier.

verses.kjv: And I saw in a vision; and it came to pass, when I saw, that I was at Shushan in the palace, which is in the province of Elam; and I saw in a vision, and I was by the river of Ulai.
verses.ct: In this vision, I found myself at the fortress of Shushan in the province of Elam, standing beside the Ulai canal.

verses.kjv: Then I lifted up mine eyes, and saw, and, behold, there stood before the river a ram which had two horns: and the two horns were high; but one was higher than the other, and the higher came up last.
verses.ct: I looked up and saw a ram standing beside the canal. It had 2 horns, both tall, but one was taller than the other, and the taller one had grown up after the first.

verses.kjv: I saw the ram pushing westward, and northward, and southward; so that no beasts might stand before him, neither was there any that could deliver out of his hand; but he did according to his will, and became great.
verses.ct: I watched the ram charge to the west, the north, and the south. No other animal could stand against it, and no one could rescue anything from its power. It did whatever it wanted and grew powerful.

verses.kjv: And as I was considering, behold, an he goat came from the west on the face of the whole earth, and touched not the ground: and the goat had a notable horn between his eyes.
verses.ct: While I was thinking about this, suddenly a male goat came from the west, racing across the entire earth so fast its feet didn't even touch the ground. This goat had a single prominent horn between its eyes.

verses.kjv: And he came to the ram that had two horns, which I had seen standing before the river, and ran unto him in the fury of his power.
verses.ct: It charged toward the 2-horned ram that I had seen standing beside the canal, rushing at it with furious strength.

verses.kjv: And I saw him come close unto the ram, and he was moved with choler against him, and smote the ram, and brake his two horns: and there was no power in the ram to stand before him, but he cast him down to the ground, and stamped upon him: and there was none that could deliver the ram out of his hand.
verses.ct: I watched it reach the ram and attack in a violent rage. It struck the ram and shattered both its horns. The ram had no strength to resist. The goat threw it to the ground and trampled it, and no one could rescue the ram from its power.

verses.kjv: Therefore the he goat waxed very great: and when he was strong, the great horn was broken; and for it came up four notable ones toward the four winds of heaven.
verses.ct: The male goat then became extremely powerful. But at the peak of its strength, the great horn snapped off, and in its place, 4 prominent horns grew up, pointing toward the 4 winds of heaven.

verses.kjv: And out of one of them came forth a little horn, which waxed exceeding great, toward the south, and toward the east, and toward the pleasant land.
verses.ct: From one of these 4 horns, a small horn emerged that grew enormously powerful, expanding toward the south, the east, and the beautiful land.

verses.kjv: And it waxed great, even to the host of heaven; and it cast down some of the host and of the stars to the ground, and stamped upon them.
verses.ct: It grew so powerful that it reached up to the army of heaven, throwing some of that heavenly army and some of the stars down to the ground, and trampling them.

verses.kjv: Yea, he magnified himself even to the prince of the host, and by him the daily sacrifice was taken away, and the place of his sanctuary was cast down.
verses.ct: It even exalted itself against the commander of heaven's army. It put a stop to the daily sacrifices and tore down the place of his sanctuary.

verses.kjv: And an host was given him against the daily sacrifice by reason of transgression, and it cast down the truth to the ground; and it practised, and prospered.
verses.ct: Because of rebellion, an army was given control over the daily sacrifice. The horn threw truth to the ground, and everything it did succeeded.

verses.kjv: Then I heard one saint speaking, and another saint said unto that certain saint which spake, How long shall be the vision concerning the daily sacrifice, and the transgression of desolation, to give both the sanctuary and the host to be trodden under foot?
verses.ct: Then I heard a holy one speaking, and another holy one asked the first, "How long will the events of this vision last — the removal of the daily sacrifice, the devastating rebellion, and the trampling of the sanctuary and heaven's army?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto me, Unto two thousand and three hundred days; then shall the sanctuary be cleansed.
verses.ct: He answered me, "It will take 2,300 evenings and mornings. After that, the sanctuary will be restored."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when I, even I Daniel, had seen the vision, and sought for the meaning, then, behold, there stood before me as the appearance of a man.
verses.ct: While I, Daniel, was watching this vision and trying to understand its meaning, suddenly someone who looked like a man appeared standing in front of me.

verses.kjv: And I heard a man’s voice between the banks of Ulai, which called, and said, Gabriel, make this man to understand the vision.
verses.ct: Then I heard a human voice calling out from between the banks of the Ulai canal, "Gabriel, explain the meaning of this vision to this man."

verses.kjv: So he came near where I stood: and when he came, I was afraid, and fell upon my face: but he said unto me, Understand, O son of man: for at the time of the end shall be the vision.
verses.ct: So Gabriel approached where I was standing. When he came near, I was terrified and fell facedown on the ground. He said to me, "Understand this, son of man — this vision concerns the time of the end."

verses.kjv: Now as he was speaking with me, I was in a deep sleep on my face toward the ground: but he touched me, and set me upright.
verses.ct: While he was speaking to me, I fell into a deep sleep with my face against the ground. But he touched me and lifted me back to my feet.

verses.kjv: And he said, Behold, I will make thee know what shall be in the last end of the indignation: for at the time appointed the end shall be.
verses.ct: He said, "Pay attention — I'm going to reveal to you what will happen during the final period of God's anger, because this concerns the appointed time of the end.

verses.kjv: The ram which thou sawest having two horns are the kings of Media and Persia.
verses.ct: The ram you saw with 2 horns represents the kings of Media and Persia.

verses.kjv: And the rough goat is the king of Grecia: and the great horn that is between his eyes is the first king.
verses.ct: The shaggy goat represents the king of Greece, and the large horn between its eyes is the first king.

verses.kjv: Now that being broken, whereas four stood up for it, four kingdoms shall stand up out of the nation, but not in his power.
verses.ct: The 4 horns that replaced the broken one represent 4 kingdoms that will emerge from that nation, but none of them will match the power of the first king.

verses.kjv: And in the latter time of their kingdom, when the transgressors are come to the full, a king of fierce countenance, and understanding dark sentences, shall stand up.
verses.ct: Near the end of their rule, when the rebels have become completely wicked, a fierce-looking king who is a master of deception will rise to power.

verses.kjv: And his power shall be mighty, but not by his own power: and he shall destroy wonderfully, and shall prosper, and practise, and shall destroy the mighty and the holy people.
verses.ct: His power will be enormous, but it won't come from his own strength. He will cause shocking destruction and will succeed in everything he does. He will destroy powerful leaders and the holy people.

verses.kjv: And through his policy also he shall cause craft to prosper in his hand; and he shall magnify himself in his heart, and by peace shall destroy many: he shall also stand up against the Prince of princes; but he shall be broken without hand.
verses.ct: Through his cunning, he will make deception thrive under his rule. He will become arrogant in his own mind, and while people are at ease, he will destroy many. He will even oppose the Prince of princes, but he will be destroyed — not by human hands.

verses.kjv: And the vision of the evening and the morning which was told is true: wherefore shut thou up the vision; for it shall be for many days.
verses.ct: The vision about the evenings and mornings that was explained to you is true. But seal up this vision, because it refers to events far in the future."

verses.kjv: And I Daniel fainted, and was sick certain days; afterward I rose up, and did the king’s business; and I was astonished at the vision, but none understood it.
verses.ct: After this, I, Daniel, was exhausted and lay sick for several days. Then I got up and went back to serving the king. But I was deeply troubled by the vision, and no one could make sense of it.
